metadata.title: CVE-2019-20485 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
qemu/qemu_driver.c in libvirt before 6.0.0 mishandles the holding of amonitor job during a query to a guest agent, which allows attackers tocause a denial of service (API blockage).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-clients - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-system - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-sanlock - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt-wireshark - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
libvirt0 - 6.0.0-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-0ubuntu4').
